en.purpose: To automate the calculation of the prostate cancer risk group to support clinical decision-making based on the Swedish National Guidelines
en.use:
To be used in patients with prostate cancer without known metastasis.

The guideline will evaluate the input parameters to assign a single risk group for the patient.

Check for Very High Risk: The patient is classified as "Very high risk" IF EITHER of the following is true:
T-stage is T3.

OR (Gleason score is 8, 9, or 10 AND Number of positive biopsy cores with Gleason 8-10 > 4).

High Risk: If not Very High Risk, the patient is classified as "High risk" IF AT LEAST ONE of the following is true:

T-stage is T2c.
Gleason score is 8, 9, or 10.
PSA at diagnosis is ≥ 20 ng/mL.

Intermediate Risk: If not Very High or High Risk, the patient is classified as "Intermediate risk" IF AT LEAST ONE of the following is true:

T-stage is T2b.
Gleason score is 7 (either 3+4 or 4+3).
PSA at diagnosis is between 10 and 19.9 ng/mL (inclusive).

Low Risk: If the patient does not meet any of the criteria for Very High, High, or Intermediate risk, they are classified as "Low risk". This corresponds to having ALL of the following:

T-stage is T1c or T2a.
AND Gleason score is ≤ 6.
AND PSA at diagnosis is < 10 ng/mL.

Very low Risk: If not low Risk, the patient is classified as "Very low risk" This corresponds to having ALL of the following:

T1c, Gleason score 6, ≤ 8 mm cancer total in 1–4 of 8–12 systematic biopsy cores, PSA < 10 µg/l and PSA density < 0.15 µg/l/cm3
en.misuse: Not applicable if any of the required inputs are missing.

other_details.en: Applies the Swedish National Guidelines to classify localized prostate cancer into Very low, Low, Intermediate, High, or Very High risk groups based on recorded clinical parameters.
